document.docAuthor: Guglielmone, Alberto A., Petney, Trevor N. & Robbins, Richard G.
document.masterDocTitle: Ixodidae (Acari: Ixodoidea): descriptions and redescriptions of all known species from 1758 to December 31, 2019

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Ixodidae (Acari: Ixodoidea): descriptions and redescriptions of all known species from 1758 to December 31, 2019

subSubSection.paragraph:
A Palearctic species, all of whose parasitic stages are usually found on Rodentia : Cricetidae and Muridae , and Soricomorpha : Soricidae and Talpidae ; adults and nymphs have been recovered from Rodentia : Myocastoridae ; adult ticks alone have been collected from Carnivora : Canidae , Galliformes : Phasianidae , and Passeriformes : Fringillidae ; nymphs and larvae have been recovered from Rodentia : Sciuridae , and Passeriformes : Turdidae ; nymphs alone have been taken from Carnivora : Felidae , and Squamata : Lacertidae ; while larvae alone have been found on Chiroptera : Vespertilionidae , and Passeriformes : Motacillidae ( Guglielmone & Robbins 2018 ,
Davies et al. 2017
).
Ixodes trianguliceps
is a very rare parasite of humans.

M:
Neumann (1902)
, under the name
Ixodes tenuirostris
, a synonym of
Ixodes trianguliceps

bibRefCitation.author: Birula, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Birula, A. (1895) Ixodidae novi vel parum cogniti Musei Zoologici Academiae Caesareae Scientiarum Petropolitanae. I. Izvestiya Imperatorskoy Akademii Nauk, Series 5, 2 (4) 353 - 364.

Ixodes trianguliceps
under the genus Exopalpiger are not included in the lists above.
